io.github.ocelot.common

Class OnlineRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.ocelot.common.OnlineRequest

  • public class OnlineRequest
extends java.lang.Object

    An asynchronous way to make requests to the internet.

    make(String, Consumer, Consumer) can be used to make a request and execute a callback when the data is received.

    An alternate option is to use make(String, Consumer) which returns a Future that will contains the data at some point in the future. In order to wait until the data is downloaded, use result = make(url).get()

    Since:
    2.0.0
    See Also:
    Consumer, Future

    • Method Detail

      • make

        public static void make(java.lang.String url,
                        java.util.function.Consumer<java.io.InputStream> callback,
                        @Nullable
                        java.util.function.Consumer<java.io.IOException> errorCallback)
        Adds a request to the queue. Use the callback to process the response fetched from the URL connection.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to make a request to
        callback - the response callback for the request
        errorCallback - The callback to use when an error occurs or null to ignore errors
